column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-08-01 06:14:08" "China won't compromise on sovereignty: Xi Jinping" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59857447.cms"" />China has rattled nerves around Asia and globally with its increasingly assertive stance in territorial disputes in the East and South China Seas and an ambitious military modernisation plan."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-08-01 06:22:03" "North Korea can hit most of United States: US officials" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59857515.cms"" />The assessment, which the officials discussed on condition of anonymity, underscored the growing threat posed by Pyongyang's nuclear and missile programs, and could add pressure on President Donald Trump's administration to respond."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-08-01 05:06:11" "'All options on table' for North Korea: White House" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59856542.cms"" />North Korea carried out an intercontinental ballistic missile test on Friday which weapons experts said could bring New York into range. According to the Pentagon, the Department of Defence is well prepared to protect the US and its allies from any provocative behaviour from North Korea."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-08-01 05:18:52" "Defiant Venezuela president mocks Trump after US sanctions" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59856698.cms"" />Oil-rich but economically ailing Venezuela awaited a fresh wave of protests against the unpopular President Maduro, whose loyalist Supreme Court had already stripped the opposition-controlled congress of its powers. Several governments joined Washington in denouncing the election, which was boycotted by the opposition."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-08-01 06:18:33" "'Disturbing' sexual harassment at Australian universities" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59857449.cms"" />"

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-08-01 04:29:40" "New WH chief shows his clout, fires Scaramucci" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59856102.cms"" />Aiming to instill some discipline in the White House, Kelly showed Anthony Scaramucci the door just days after the new communications director had unleashed an expletive-laced tirade against senior staff members. President Trump dismissed any talk of disarray."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-07-31 18:48:46" "6 candidates in race for Pakistan's PM poll" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59851031.cms"" />Pakistan's opposition parties on Monday failed to agree on a joint candidate against PML-N's Shahid Khaqan Abbasi for the prime minister's election, with six candidates filing their nomination papers for the polls scheduled to be held on Tuesday."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-07-31 18:34:33" "Trump seeks order, discipline with new chief of staff" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59850935.cms"" />Donald Trump installed retired Marine Corps general John Kelly as his new chief of staff on Monday, hoping to bring order and discipline to a White House beset by scandal, infighting, low approval ratings and legislative defeats."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-08-01 05:12:27" "Harvard Law alumni list marks Scaramucci as dead " "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59856560.cms"" />The directory mailed to alumni this week had an asterisk next to Scaramucci's name, indicating he had died. Harvard Law School acknowledged the directory error in a statement and apologized to Scaramucci."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-07-31 13:59:31" "IS claims attack on Iraq embassy in Kabul" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59847310.cms"" />A suicide bomber blew himself up outside the Iraqi embassy in Kabul Monday and militants breached the compound, Afghan officials said, in a complex hours-long attack claimed by the Islamic State group."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-07-31 16:14:23" "Chinese Army trains all-women brigade " "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59849205.cms"" />China's People's Liberation Army is training an all-women special operations force over cold mountains and high seas. But it won't reveal where they may be deployed in real battle scenario, which is something rival armies such as the one in India may want to know."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-07-31 11:21:20" "China tells Trump not to link trade to North Korea" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59844565.cms"" />""We believe that the North Korea nuclear issue and China-US trade are two issues that are in two completely different domains,"" vice minister of commerce Qian Keming said on Monday."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-07-31 12:34:18" "Pak interim PM nominee facing Rs 220bn graft inquiry" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59846109.cms"" />The ruling PML-N party's interim prime minister nominee Shahid Khaqan Abbasi is facing a Rs 220 billion corruption inquiry by Pakistan's National Accountability Bureau over an LNG contract, according to a media report."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-07-31 08:45:30" "Maduro claims vote win, opposition vows protests" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59842820.cms"" />Ten people were killed in a wave of bloodshed that swept Venezuela Sunday as Maduro defied an opposition boycott and international condemnation — including the threat of new US sanctions — to hold elections for a powerful new ""Constituent Assembly."""

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-07-31 05:25:00" "Ten killed as Venezuela vote turns violent" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59840285.cms"" />""We do not recognize this fraudulent process,"" he said at the close of voting, calling for nationwide marches Monday and a mass protest in Caracas Wednesday, the day the new ""Constituent Assembly"" is due to be installed."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-07-31 04:53:27" "Europe mulls tax on Google for displaying news articles" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59839895.cms"" />Google is furious at the idea, but publishers, including Axel Springer or Rupert Murdoch's Newscorp, affirm that a tax is the only hope to save a news industry starving for revenue. The fight is the latest row between Google and EU, which slapped the firm with a $2.8 billion fine over unfair competition in June."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-07-31 04:01:42" "Japan's Abe talks to Trump on North Korea" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59839476.cms"" />Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe spoke with US President Donald Trump on Monday and agreed on the need for further action on North Korea just hours after the US Ambassador to the United Nations said the United States is ""done talking about North Korea""."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-07-30 19:24:56" "Youth opposition leader killed in Venezuela vote" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59836180.cms"" />A youth opposition leader was killed in Venezuela on Sunday in a protest against a contentious election organized by President Nicolas Maduro, prosecutors said."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-07-30 16:32:06" "US successfully tests missile intercept system" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59834200.cms"" />American forces successfully tried out on Sunday a missile interception system the US hopes to set up on the Korean peninsula, military officials said following a trial just days after North Korea's second test of an ICBM."

column1: en_IND_tindia_int "2017-07-30 16:09:03" "Two dead, four wounded in German nightclub shooting" "
column3: src=""http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/photo/59834043.cms"" />A gunman opened fire at a packed nightclub in southern Germany on Sunday, killing one and wounding four before being shot by police, authorities said, in an attack likely motivated by a personal feud."
